snippet: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, opted not to include them on a list of armies and guerrilla groups that kill and maim children in conflicts worldwide.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon, under pressure from United States and Israel and in opposition to advice of senior envoy Leila Zerrougui, chooses to omit both Israeli Defense Forces and Hamas from list of armies and guerrilla groups that harm children; list is part of annual report on children's rights violations that includes information on children who were killed and injured by both groups.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, opted not to include them on a list of armies and guerrilla groups that kill and maim children in conflicts worldwide.

headline.main: Israel and Hamas Are Kept Off a Grim List
headline.print_headline: List of Abuses Bypasses Israel and Hamas

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
